elements.name: upgrading
elements.label: Are you upgrading your CloudGuard VMSS solution?
elements.toolTip: Select 'Yes' if you are upgrading your CloudGuard VMSS solution.

options.text:
All the configurations below must be similar to the existing CloudGuard VMSS solution.

Note that the target load balancers are the ones connected to your existing CloudGuard VMSS solution.

See the Deployment Guide for more information.

elements.name: dnsZoneResourceId
elements.label: DNS Zone Resource ID
elements.toolTip: The Azure Dns Zone ID to be used for defining a Record Set with VMSS Instances' public IPs

constraints.validationMessage: DNS Zone resource ID must strat with "/subscriptions/" and contain "/providers/Microsoft.Network/dnszones".The DNS Zone resource ID can be found in the DNS Zone Properties tab

options.text: In case an existing Record Set is used, all its records will be replaced with VMSS Instances' public IPs.

elements.name: dnsZoneRecordSetName
elements.label: New or existing DNS Zone Record Set Name (Label)
elements.toolTip: The DNS Zone Record Set contains VMSS Instances' public IPs. A new or an existing Record Set can be used. In case an existing Record Set is used, all its records will be replaced with VMSS Instances' public IPs.

constraints.validationMessage: Each Record Set must only contain letters, numbers, underscores, and/or dashes, the value must be 1-63 characters long. Each label should be separated from other labels by a period. A wildcard ('*' character) is permitted either as the single character in the name, or as the first label in the name. An empty value, or a single '@' character is permitted for record sets at the zone apex .

options.text: For Remote Access VPN configuration it is mandatory to deploy instance level public IP addresses.
